benchmark_details.name: GUI Testing Arena: A Unified Benchmark for Advancing Autonomous GUI Testing
benchmark_details.overview: GTArena provides a formalized framework for evaluating the entire process of automated GUI Testing, divided into three key subtasks: test intention generation, test task execution, and GUI defect detection, equipping researchers with a standardized environment.
benchmark_details.data_type: multimodal data including real mobile applications, applications with artificially injected defects, and synthetic data

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To establish a formalized end-to-end framework for Autonomous GUI Testing and introduce a novel data structure for GUI defects.

data.source: Real-world mobile applications, applications with injected defects, and synthetic defect datasets.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of models in generating test intentions, executing test tasks, and detecting GUI defects.
methodology.interpretation: Results are interpreted against the established benchmarks to determine performance gaps.
methodology.validation: Comparison against human testers' performance for a comprehensive evaluation.
